content: this text summarizes the progress of a legal case involving a matrimonial property regime the parties involved are mr tjc and mrs rm who are going through a divorce the divorce was finalized in 2016 and transcribed in the civil status registers in 2018 a notary was appointed to carry out the inventory accounts and liquidation of the matrimonial property regime the process began with an introductory meeting in november 2017 and the opening of operations in february 2019 an inventory report was drawn up in september 2019 in august 2020 a liquidation statement was prepared by the notary determining the net asset status of the couples community property the parties were summoned to review the statement and attend a meeting in september 2020 if disputes remain unresolved the court will be involved the text then discusses a judgment issued by the family court in november 2021 approving the liquidation statement with certain reservations it states that mrs r is entitled to an occupancy allowance and mr t must pay her a procedural indemnity the judgment also mentions a deduction from mr ts share corresponding to an overpayment on joint accounts the judgment was served to mr t in february 2022 both parties were summoned by the notary to sign the closing liquidation statement in september 2022 however mr t issued a contradiction outside the allowed time period so it was not accepted the text also mentions various costs incurred during the legal process totaling 10'575,65â‚¬ with a balance due of 4'575,65â‚¬ the text further discusses the calculation of the occupancy allowance payable to mrs r the sharing project and the proposed assignment of assets it states that mr t is indebted to mrs r for a specific amount in addition to the occupancy allowance and reimbursement of common expenses on the other hand mr t is owed a net sum after deducting certain amounts the text concludes by mentioning that the amount paid today has been recorded by the notary another part of the text discusses the allocation of real estate properties including an apartment garage box and parking space in schaerbeek and a property in bertogne the cadastral income for each property is mentioned along with the ownership history and encumbrance by a mortgage debt the estimated market value of the properties is provided the text also discusses the assignment of ownership rights and the obligations related to the properties it concludes by mentioning the administrative and environmental situation of the properties lastly the text addresses a legal document related to an expropriation order and legislation regarding mines quarries and disused sites it mentions the transfer of property application of a royal decree soil condition obligations related to soil management and remediation intended use of the property requirements for oil tanks flood risk areas subsequent intervention file and termination of legal proceedings the document is certified by a notary and includes information about the parties identities and conflicting interests it concludes with information about writing fees and is signed by the parties and the notary
